alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 4:28AM EDT until August 24 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio, northeast Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Erie, Huron and Lorain. In northeast Ohio, Medina. In northwest Ohio, Ottawa. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 428 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lorain, Sandusky, Norwalk, Western Vermilion, Vermilion, Amherst, Bellevue, Willard, Wellington, New London, Plymouth, Milan, Northern Milan, Wakeman, Castalia, Sullivan, Penfield, Greenwich, Monroeville and Marblehead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
